Use case of setting up an action to copy data from object to object
The ability to copy data from one object to another can be implemented by setting up a
custom action
.
Let’s say we need to create an action that will copy data from the client’s profile to the client’s application.
Setting up an action includes:
creating a set of attributes to copy
;
creating an action with the "Copy data" module
.
Creating a set of attributes to copy
First, add attributes from the  existing "Client" object type to the "Client application" object type:
To create a set of attributes, go to the registry of "Copy attributes. Set option" [SYS_COPY] type and create a new instance by clicking
(more about
working with registries
).
In the window that opens, fill in the following parameters:
After filling in the necessary parameters, save a set of attributes for copying using
.
Creating an action with the "Copy data" module
To display the "Copy" button in the "Client Application" type profile:
Go to the
"Actions"
registry, create a new action and specify the parameters:
in the "Name" field, specify "Copy" – the specified name will be displayed on the button;
select "Copy data" as the user interface module;
display in the profile – select the "Yes" value;
in the "Action type" field – select the "Action" value;
in the "Additional action parameters", click
and create the Copy element (where th e previuosly created set of attributes to copy is selected):
in the "Related object types" block, select the "Client profile" value.
Save the  action settings by clicking
.
